page.title: 04Gt.Coxwell's Communications
page.content: Communication is mainly by 2 methods: telephone and mail.There are 2 public telephones,one within the village adjacent to Chapel House and one emer- gency instrument outside on the A420 road close to the Gt.Coxwell round- about.The majority of residents also have private telephones at home and 2 have car phones.One resident also has a document transmitter via the tele- phone.The postal service comprises one morning and evening collection from the box opposite the Post Office five days a week and one collection on Sat- urdays.One morning delivery to each house six days a week and nothing on Sundays.An express courier service is available,guaranteeing delivery of a short message within two hours.A few residents have Citizen Band radios, which have helped summon aid in cases of emergency,i.e.road accidents.
